```{r setup, include=FALSE}
knitr::opts_chunk$set(echo = TRUE)

library(tidyverse)
library(dplyr)
library(readxl)
library(janitor)
library(readr)
library(ggplot2)

#get inequality data. May be able to explain fluctuations in happiness. also compare difference between gdp per capita and median income.

#Find dominant religion in each country plot mean happiness or by color by religion.

#Find freedom index, free press. Average number of children

gun_deaths <- read.csv("raw-data/gun_deaths2.csv")%>%
  clean_names()%>%
  rename(country_name = location)

education <- read.csv("raw-data/education2.csv")%>%
  clean_names()

literacy <- read.csv("raw-data/literacy.csv")%>%
  clean_names()%>%
  rename(country_name = name)%>%
  select(-pop2019)

cost_of_living <- read_csv("raw-data/cost_of_living.csv")%>%
  clean_names()%>%
  rename(country_name = name)%>%
  select(country_name, cost_of_living_index)

happiness <- read.csv("raw-data/data.csv")%>%
  clean_names()%>%
  rename(country_name = name)

gdpPerCapita <- readxl::read_xls("raw-data/gdp.xls", skip = 3)%>%
  clean_names()

urbanization <- readxl::read_xls("raw-data/urbanization.xls", skip =3)%>%
  clean_names()%>%
  rename(urbanization = x2018)%>%
  select(country_name, urbanization)

gdpPerCapita2 <- gdpPerCapita%>%
  select(country_name, country_code, x2018)

master1 <- happiness%>%
  full_join(gdpPerCapita2)

master1

cleaned <- read_csv("raw-data/troubleshoot1.csv")

cleaned1 <- cleaned%>%
  filter(is.na(x2018))%>%
  select(country_name, country_code)%>%
  left_join(gdpPerCapita2, by = "country_code")%>%
  select(country_name.x, country_code, x2018)%>%
  rename(country_name = country_name.x)



master <- cleaned%>%
  filter(!is.na(x2018))%>%
  full_join(cleaned1)%>%
  filter(!is.na(happiness_rank))



master <- master%>%
  left_join(cost_of_living, by = "country_name")

view(master)

master <- master%>%
  left_join(literacy, by = "country_name")



view(master)


```

```{r}
ggplot(master, aes(x = x2018, y = happiness_score))+
  geom_point()+
  scale_x_log10()

ggplot(master, aes(x = cost_of_living_index, y = happiness_score))+
  geom_point()+
  scale_x_log10()

ggplot(master, aes(x = gun_deaths, y = happiness_score))+
  geom_point()+
  scale_x_log10()

ggplot(master, aes(x = literacy_rate, y = happiness_score))+
  geom_point()

ggplot(master, aes(x = x2018, y = total_score))+
  geom_point()+
  scale_x_log10()

ggplot(master, aes(x = urbanization, y = happiness_score))+
  geom_point()

ggplot(master, aes(x = x2018, y = urbanization))+
  geom_point()+
  scale_x_log10()

```
